## function note
1.in print,must use "" , or object 'word' not found. However, it can print TRUE and FALSE
2."if else" for vector â€˜the condition has length > 1'

```{r function}
#test 1 TRUE vs "TRUE"; result : TRUE vs ""TRUE 
above50 <- function(x) {
  if (x > 50){
  print (TRUE)
    } else if (x < 50){
  print (FALSE)
    } else {print(FALSE)
    }}

above50(78)
above50(90)
above50(32)
above50(66)
above50(Score)

above51 <- function(x) {
  if (x > 50){
  print ("TRUE")
    } else if (x < 50){
  print ("FALSE")
    } else {print("FALSE")
    }}
above51(50)
above51(60)
above51(30)
above51(Score)

#test 2 other words; result: need ""; or object 'word' not found
above52 <- function(x) {
  if (x > 50){
  print ("correct")
    } else if (x < 50){
  print ("ncorrect")
    } else {print("ncorrect")
    }}

above53 <- function(x) {
  if (x > 50){
  print (correct)
    } else if (x < 50){
  print (ncorrect)
    } else {print(ncorrect)
    }}

## in print,must use "" , or object 'word' not found. However, it can print TRUE and FALSE
above53(50)
above53(60)
above53(30)


#test 3, print in ifelse.



above <- function(x){
  ifelse(x < 50, print("FALSE"), print("TRUE"))}
above(50)
above(Score)
above(50)
above(60)
above(30)

result <- above(40); result

above1 <- function(x){
  ifelse(x < 50, print(print("FALSE")), print("TRUE"))}

above1(50)
above1(Score)

above2 <- function(x){
  ifelse(x < 50, {print("FALSE");"FALSE"},print("TRUE"))
}
above2(50)
above2(Score)




```
